intro: Tabernaemontana urguiculata, commonly known as the fragrant starflower, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are known for their pleasant, spicy fragrance. Tabernaemontana urguiculata is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance and unique scent.
